data.title: Treasury Secretary Yellen reaffirms U.S. could run out of money to pay bills by early June
data.description: Citing additional data, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen reaffirmed to Congress that the U.S. could default on its debt as early as June 1.

data.title: China's security crackdown could signal new realities for foreign investors
data.description: Foreign investors are left wondering if Beijing's crackdown on due diligence firms is another way China is limiting foreign access to investment information.

data.title: Consumer debt passes $17 trillion for the first time despite slide in mortgage demand
data.description: The total for borrowing across all categories hit $17.05 trillion, an increase of nearly $150 billion, or 0.9% during the January-to-March period.

data.title: China's economic data misses expectations as economy continues to show uneven recovery
data.description: China's activity data for April continued to show an uneven path for recovery as the economy continues to emerge from the impact of its stringent Covid restrictions.

data.title: As the wind power industry looks to super-sized turbines, disruptors are betting on radical designs
data.description: New designs and ideas are providing a glimpse into how wind energy could develop in the future.

data.title: Paul Tudor Jones says the Fed is done raising rates, stocks to finish the year higher from here
data.description: Paul Tudor Jones believes the Fed has finished raising interest rates in its fight against inflation, and the stock market could grind higher this year.

data.title: 'Guardians of the Galaxy: Vol. 3' had best second weekend box office hold for MCU in 5 years
data.description: Guardians' second weekend box office drop was the smallest one for the Marvel Cinematic Universe since the original "Black Panther" in 2018.

data.title: A pair of sports betting deals has the gaming industry asking, 'Who's next?'
data.description: Fanatics' splashy $150 million acquisition of PointsBet's U.S. business wasn't the only deal in gambling in recent days. It could be a sign of more to come.

data.title: U.S. Virgin Islands issued subpoena to Elon Musk in Jeffrey Epstein lawsuit
data.description: Elon Musk is the latest big name issued a subpoena by the U.S. Virgin Islands for its lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase over sex trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein.

data.title: EU approves Microsoft's $69 billion acquisition of Activision Blizzard, clearing huge hurdle
data.description: Microsoft offered remedies in cloud gaming to earn the approval of European Union regulators for the $69 billion Activision Blizzard acquisition.

data.title: Will history repeat? Here are Club stocks that were great buys during 2011 debt-ceiling market swoon
data.description: With concerns about a potential U.S. government default mounting, here's how 31 of our Club stocks fared during — and after — the 2011 debt-ceiling saga.

data.title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says he must approve all new hires in internal email
data.description: "No one can join Tesla, even as a contractor, until you receive my email approval," Musk wrote in an email to all employees at the automaker.

data.title: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis looks nearly ready to launch his White House bid
data.description: The DeSantis political operation is moving offices, potentially triggering a 15-day window for him to file paperwork declaring his intent to run for president.

data.title: Universal flu vaccine based on mRNA tech to be tested by National Institutes of Health
data.description: Scientists hope the vaccine will protect against a variety of flu strains and provide long-term immunity so people do not have to receive a shot every year.

data.title: More than 140 Democrats defend CFPB in case before Supreme Court that threatens agency's existence
data.description: Democrats defended the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau as a case at the Supreme Court challenges its constitutionality.

data.title: Biden to nominate cancer surgeon Monica Bertagnolli to lead National Institutes of Health
data.description: The NIH, which funds medical research, played a key role in developing the messenger RNA technology that underlies the Covid vaccine made by Moderna.

data.title: A new company wants to give you a free TV, in exchange for always showing you ads
data.description: Telly is offering 500,000 free 55-inch TVs to consumers willing to have a steady stream of advertisements in their homes.

data.title: Microsoft releases update that allows iPhone users to text from Windows
data.description: PC users want the ability to text from their laptops at work or at school.

data.title: Southeast Asia hit with record-breaking heat and heavy air pollution
data.description: Bangkok, the capital of Thailand, experienced a record temperature of 105.8 degrees Fahrenheit (41 degrees Celsius) over the weekend.

data.title: Why investors 'always misunderstand' the difficulty of regaining a loss, says advisor
data.description: To return to baseline, investors must always get a better return relative to their initial loss.

data.title: Elon Musk still needs 'Twitter sitter,' judges rule
data.description: Elon Musk had been fighting to unwind parts of a settlement agreement he and Tesla struck with the SEC over civil securities fraud charges in 2018.

data.title: Post-Covid, post-bankruptcy Hertz is all-in on electric, with big implications for the EV, auto and rideshare market
data.description: Hertz big Tesla fleet purchase was a milestone for the EV market, and the rental car company's electric vehicle strategy continues to grow.

data.title: Fed's Bostic casts doubt on rate cuts this year even if there's a recession
data.description: Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic and Chicago Fed President Austan Goolsbee spoke Monday on CNBC's "Squawk Box."

data.title: Here's how much emergency savings you need amid economic uncertainty, according to financial advisors
data.description: More than half of Americans don’t have an emergency fund, according to a CNBC/Momentive survey. Here's how to figure out how much emergency savings you need.

data.title: SpaceX hires former NASA human spaceflight official Kathy Lueders to help with Starship
data.description: Kathy Lueders represents a key hire for SpaceX as it aims to make its massive Starship rocket safe to fly people in the coming years.

data.title: There may never be a better time to create a retirement plan
data.description: With recent passage of the Secure 2.0 legislation, many small businesses should consider starting a retirement plan. The tax savings can be big, costs are down.

data.title: US credit card debt stands at a record of nearly $1 trillion. 5 moves to pay down your balance
data.description: Inflation and higher interest rates kept credit card debt at $986 billion at the start of 2023.

data.title: Turkey will hold a runoff election on May 28, with Erdogan in the lead
data.description: The election in the sharply divided country of 85 million people could hardly come at a more pivotal time.

data.title: Here's what media giants face as they try to charm advertisers this week
data.description: Media companies will put on their annual Upfront shows this week, which come as the industry faces challenges including a soft ad market.

data.title: Vice Media files for bankruptcy to enable sale to lenders including Soros and Fortress
data.description: Once a digital media darling, Vice Media Group on Monday filed for bankruptcy protection after years of financial troubles.
